subject: Photography
title: Mixed Lighting Challenges
description: A quick, practical guide to Mixed Lighting Challenges.

hook.text: A room lit by a window and a lamp. One is blue, one is orange. Your camera can't correct both at once.

buildup.text: Mixed lighting occurs when multiple light sources with different color temperatures illuminate the same scene.

discovery.text: The camera sets one white balance for the whole frame. One source looks right while the other looks wrong.

twist.text: Mixed lighting isn't always bad. The contrast between warm and cool areas can add depth and mood.

climax.text: Professionals use gels on their flash units to match ambient light color ‚Äî solving the mismatch at the source.

punchline.text: When lights disagree, pick a side. Or use a gel.

quiz.question: How do professionals solve mixed lighting problems?
options: They use colored gels on flash units to match the ambient light color
They only use one light source
They shoot only in black and white
